content: A rectangular garden measures 20 feet in length and 10 feet in width. What is the perimeter of the garden?

The perimeter of a rectangle is calculated by adding up all its sides. Since a rectangle has two pairs of equal sides, the formula for perimeter is P = 2*(length + width). So, for this garden that's 20 feet long and 10 feet wide, the perimeter would be P = 2*(20 + 10) = 2*(30) = 60 feet. Therefore, the perimeter of the garden is 60 feet.
